thread.title: A salty message to Roger Goodell appeared in the snow in Copley and don’t pretend you’re surprised
thread.title_full: A salty message to Roger Goodell appeared in the snow in Copley and don’t pretend you’re surprised - The Boston Globe

title: A salty message to Roger Goodell appeared in the snow in Copley and don’t pretend you’re surprised
text:
Google+
A portion of the message to Roger Goodell was seen from the former Hancock Tower.
By Christina Prignano Globe staff February 07, 2017
Something like this was bound to happen.
A message for NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell was scrawled in the snow across the most of Copley Square Tuesday before the Patriots parade. The message was largely unprintable—it contained the words “Goodell,” a word that rhymes with “duck,” and an outline of a male body part. Office workers in the area snapped photos and posted them to social media.
Advertisement
Although the Patriots were triumphantly rolling through Boston on Duck Boats, it seems some fans were still bitter about how the team’s championship season began.
It was not immediately clear when the message was written, but snow began falling in Boston around 9 a.m. this morning.
Here’s a link to the message. Warning: Vulgar content, especially if you aren’t a Patriots fan.
Christina Prignano can be reached at christina.prignano@globe.com . Follow her on Twitter @cprignano .
